concise_definition: v. 抽动, 颤动; n. 抽动, 颤动

definitions.explanation_en: To make a sudden, small, involuntary movement, especially of a muscle or part of the body, often due to nervousness, fatigue, or irritation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指肌肉或身体某部分因紧张、疲劳或刺激而突然、轻微、不自主地抽动。
definitions.example_en: His eye began to twitch after hours of staring at the computer screen.
definitions.example_cn: 他连续数小时盯着电脑屏幕后，眼睛开始抽动。

definitions.explanation_en: To move or shake with quick, jerky motions, often describing the movement of animals or objects under tension.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以快速、断续的动作移动或抖动，常用于描述动物或处于张力下的物体。
definitions.example_en: The cat's tail twitched as it watched the bird outside the window.
definitions.example_cn: 猫看到窗外的鸟时，尾巴轻轻抽动。

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, brief, involuntary movement, especially of a muscle or part of the body.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指肌肉或身体某部分突然、短暂、不自主的抽动。
definitions.example_en: She noticed a twitch in her left cheek after drinking too much coffee.
definitions.example_cn: 她喝太多咖啡后，注意到左脸颊出现了一阵抽动。

definitions.explanation_en: A live-streaming platform primarily used for broadcasting video game play, often with real-time audience interaction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个主要用于直播电子游戏并支持实时观众互动的在线直播平台。
definitions.example_en: He streams his gaming sessions on Twitch every evening.
definitions.example_cn: 他每天晚上都在 Twitch 上直播自己的游戏过程。

comparison.analysis: “Spasm”（痉挛）指肌肉剧烈、疼痛性的不自主收缩，通常更强烈、更持久，常与病理状态相关；而 “twitch” 更轻微、短暂，多为生理或情绪性反应，不伴随疼痛。
“Shiver”（颤抖）通常由寒冷或恐惧引起，是全身性或大范围的、有节奏的抖动；而 “twitch” 是局部、快速、非节奏性的微小抽动，多限于单个肌肉或小区域。
“Stream”（直播）是泛指任何实时视频传输，而 “Twitch” 是一个专有名词，特指以游戏直播为核心的平台。虽然 “twitch” 作动词时指抽动，但作为名词时已成为一个文化符号，专指该平台，与一般意义上的 “stream” 有本质区别。
